description:
Adds a blur look to different parts of the GNOME Shell, including the top panel, dash and overview.

Contains some bugs due to the implementation of the blur effect on gnome shell, see https: //gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/-/issues/2857 for more informations.

There is a particular bug with Gnome 3.38 and the last version: entire parts of some applications disappear until you move the window...
To fix this, you can either:
- downgrade to a previous version (version 5 should work, but I'm not sure, please let me know if not)
- or use this extension: https: //extensions.gnome.org/extension/545/hide-top-bar/ ; it will hide topbar and (weirdly) it entirely removes all the annoying visual bugs.

Added support for Gnome 40 :)
name: Blur my Shell
